raw_comment: This graph compares the percentages of 15-24 year old adults to 40+ year old adults on their view point on if the world is getting better. There are two different generations with two different perspectives on the world. I noticed that within this graph, the generation of 15-24 year olds in almost every country thinks that the world is getting better more than the generation of 40 year olds. I wonder what factors come in to play to have Indonesia presented as an outlier. Are there environmental factors or lifestyle factor choices that make both age groups think the world is getting better? Were there any life changing events that occurred in Indonesia that would make it an outlier? This relates to our community because everything in our world advances on the daily and people are coming up with new things and ways to make our world better. Are these new ways of life actually making our world better or do these younger generations just assume and think the world is better than what it was?
ace_sentences: This graph compares the percentages of adults who are 15-24 years old with the percentages of adults who are 40+ years old.
The graph shows the viewpoints of these adults about whether the world is getting better.
There are two generations in the graph.
These two generations have two different perspectives on the world.
In almost every country, the 15-24-year-old adults think that the world is getting better more than the 40+-year-old adults think that the world is getting better.
Indonesia is an outlier in the graph.
I wonder which factors cause Indonesia to be an outlier.
I wonder whether environmental factors cause both age groups in Indonesia to think that the world is getting better.
I wonder whether lifestyle choices cause both age groups in Indonesia to think that the world is getting better.
I wonder whether life-changing events occurred in Indonesia.
I wonder whether these life-changing events caused Indonesia to be an outlier.
Everything in our world advances daily.
People come up with new things daily.
People come up with new ways to make our world better.
I wonder whether these new ways of life actually make our world better.
I wonder whether the younger generations only assume that the world is better than it was.
